results.title: Jail Bait
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation and Charles Lamont
results.brief_description: A comedy film starring Buster Keaton. Keaton plays the role of a character who gets caught up in a twisted plot to catch a murderer. Keaton agrees to participate in the plot after being promised a share of the reward money.

results.title: Jaguar
results.brief_description:
Feature film by French film-maker Jean Rouch, filmed in West Africa, about three young men who leave their life of cattle herding in the arid savanna bordering the Sahara, and travel thousands of miles to Ghana (then the Gold Coast) and back again. Rouch uses non-actors who improvise their parts. ‘A brilliant example of the role which creative interpretation can play in ethnographic film-making’. (David MacDougall in Film Quarterly). Dedicated to Gerard Philipe.

Credits: Producer, Pierre Braunberger ; director, Jean Rouch ; music, Enos Amelolon, Tallou Mouzourane, Amisata Gaoudelize, Djenne Molo Kari, Yankori, Ama.
Cast: Damoure Zika, Lam Ibrahima Dia, Illo Gaoudel, Amadou Koffo.

results.title: Jafar's blue tiles (Iran)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “World cultures and youth”.
The restoration of a 600-year-old brick dome in his village is the focal point of fourteen-year-old Jafar’s interests and activities as he is seen making and installing twelve richly colored tiles that adorn the dome. Told from Jafar’s point of view, explains the significance of the project and the brickmaking process in the culture and customs of his country and captures vistas of the Iranian landscape.

results.title: Jade Snow
results.creator_credit: Nola Safro, Films Incorporated, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.) and Ron Finley
results.brief_description: The Chinese-American success story of Jade Snow Wong who rejected the traditional role of female subservience to her father and brother and became an accomplished author. Shows the differences in family life-styles between American and Chinese-Americans. Very moving bio-pic of this 5th daughter who graduated with honours, won a State essay prize and worked for the Navy during World War II.

results.title: Jacques Prevert
results.brief_description:
Profile of the long and diverse career of Jacques Prevert, from his early beginning as a sketch writer for the Agit-Prop (revolutionary) theatre group ‘Octobre’, to screenwriter for Marcel Carne and free-verse poet, whose texts have become classics of the French chanson and an all-time favorite of school children. The portrait is that of a tender anarchist and bon-vivant whose ferocious wit would be used to mock the hypocrisy of those who stand for moral, order and against the enjoyment of the simple pleasures of life. The films contains numerous excerpts of films scripted by Prevert, including ‘Les visiteurs du soir’, ‘Quai des Brumes’ (both held in our collection) as well as poems interpreted by Maurice Baquet. Includes interviews of Prevert’s friends and interprets: Francis Lemarque, Jean Wiener, Raymond Bussieres, Michele Morgan, Paul Grimault, Alain Cuny, Jean-Louis Barrault, Arletty.

Credits: Director, Jean Desvilles ; photography, Maurice Giraud ; music, Joseph Kosma, Francis Lemarque.

results.title: Jacques Lipchitz: master sculptor
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: A colour portrait of one of the foremost pioneers in modern art. Born in Lithuania, Jacques Lipchitz now lives in New York. Some of his works are inspired by the past while others are a reflection of present times. As he works in his studio on a portrait of the late President Kennedy, Lipchitz adds his own insight, his own knowledge about the man, and his own interpretation of the times.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Bert Van Bork and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films

results.title: Jacques le Fataliste et Son Maitre
results.brief_description:
Jacques, who believes in fate, is involved in an endless argument with his master, who does not, as they journey along retelling the stories of their lives and loves.

Credits: Director, Pierre Cardinal ; photography, Jacques Lemare.
Cast: Marie Dubois, Margo Lion, Alexandre Rignault, Claude Gensac, Madeleine Renaud, Jacques Castelot, Jean Paredes.

results.title: Jacques Henri Lartigue, Peintre et Photographe
results.brief_description:
“If we think of photography as a documentary art, our attention is likely to focus first on images of battle or disaster, deprivation or unrest. Indeed, outside the familiar confines of the family album or the surreal arena of celebrity, archival photographs most powerfully frame gritty realities our eyes might otherwise avoid. Not so with the pictures of Jacques Henri Lartigue (1894-1986), who produced stunning and sophisticated images from the time he was seven years old. Lartigue was in love with motion, and his subjects cars racing, flying machines and glider planes, people jumping, fashionable ladies strolling in the park, vacationers at the seashore and the races embody the exhilaration of movement. Zany and amusing, Lartigue’s work seems a testament to happiness itself, and this book with 126 duotone photos and 16 gatefolds is a fitting celebration of his legacy.” Reference: Vicki Goldberg. ‘Jacques Henri Lartigue, photographer’. Bulfinch Press, 1998.

Credits: Producer, Bernard Meusnier ; director, Francois Reichenbach ; photographer, Francois Reichenbach, Gerard de Battista.
Cast: Interviewees include Michel Tournier, Jean-Michel Folon and Charlotte Rampling.

results.title: Jacques-Louis David (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Colin Clark, John Brabourne Productions and Visual Programme Systems
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Romantic vs classic art”.
Looks at some famous works of the French artist, Jacques-Louis David, which bear all the strengths and weaknesses of Classicism. Narrated by Kenneth Clark.
